abstract: Larry Fink, head of BlackRock, criticized the “luxurious” trading profits enjoyed by Wall Street banks, even as Christine Lagarde of France slammed bonus practices.
snippet: Larry Fink, head of BlackRock, criticized the “luxurious” trading profits enjoyed by Wall Street banks, even as Christine Lagarde of France slammed bonus practices.
lead_paragraph: Laurence D. Fink, the head of the asset manager BlackRock, on Tuesday criticized the “luxurious” trading profits enjoyed by Wall Street banks, saying that they had taken advantage of less competition to charge clients more for even basic trades, The Financial Times reported.

headline.main: Fink and French Minister Take Aim at Wall Street
